newsitem.title: FRANCE: MATIF to offer new white sugar futures contract.
newsitem.headline: MATIF to offer new white sugar futures contract.

text.p: The French futures exchange MATIF said on Friday it will open a new futures contract for white sugar with an Icumsa rating of 100 to better reflect existing world trade flows.
Trading will start on the October 1997 expiry on June 20, MATIF said in a statement.

Sugars with ratings close to 100 are mainly produced in South America, Central America and Asia and currently account for over a third of world trade in sugar but were only partially covered by existing futures contracts in New York, London, or Paris, MATIF said.
